bibl.title: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Philip Showalter Hench, February 5, 1948

div1.p: Lyons seeks material to be reproduced in a program for the unveiling of the Walter Reed bust at the Hall of Fame. She solicits suggestions from Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Philip Showalter Hench, February 5, 1948

Every American is a shareholder in the Hall of Fame
HALL OF FAME : NEW YORK UNIVERSITY
I MADISON AVENUE · NEW YORK IO, N.Y.
Telephone: MURRAY HILL 3-4469
5 February 1948.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
You may be interested to know that Dr. Walter
Reed's bronzes are to be unveiled at the Hall of Fame on the
20th of May, with what we hope will be a distinguished cere-
mony. For the purposes of our program of the event, we
are endeavoring to find interesting material for reproduction -
photographs, manuscripts, etc.

In going through General Truby's informative “Memoir
of Walter Reed” I find that General Truby was aided considerably
by you in the preparation of his volume. In view of this, I
am taking the liberty of addressing myself to you in the hope
that you will be willing to suggest something significant which
can be reproduced in our program. For your information
and guidance, I am sending you some programs of our recent cere-
monies which will give you some idea of the kind of material we
are seeking.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Bertha L. Lyons
Assistant to the Director Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
